content.question: Consider the following two statements.Statement I: For 3 < t < 4.5, the velocity of the object is decreasing.Statement II: For 3 < t < 4.5, the speed of the object is increasing.Are either or both of these statements correct? For each statement provide a reason why it is correct or not correct.

frqParts.text: Consider the following two statements.Statement I: For 3 < t < 4.5, the velocity of the object is decreasing.Statement II: For 3 < t < 4.5, the speed of the object is increasing.Are either or both of these statements correct? For each statement provide a reason why it is correct or not correct.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
